answers.answer: Then tell the doctor you don't want it. They can't force you into an induction, wait until 41 weeks.
I have gestation diabetes so yes they are making me. They want to take him this week but I cried and pleaded and they are giving me another week
They said the risk are to high to let me go on

Oh, well then it would be better. Not all inductions are bad, or long. Mine wasn't that bad, I was up and moving less than an hour afterwards and my son was alert and just fine as soon as he was born. With this being your second it might go by quickly and smoothly!
Have you ever had a natural birth? Did you get an Epidural?

A natural birth is via vaginal. I did get the epidural with my son. Even if you get induced and they use pitocin but you don't get pain meds, it's still natural. I know you had other plans for your delivery, but in your situation you may not have that option. Hopefully you go into labor on your own. My doctor told me that she would break my water and give it an hour or two and see if my body naturally progressed. If I don't start getting steady contractions then pitocin would come in. Maybe if you talk to your doctor they will do it tooIt's your body you have a lot more control of what will happen then most doctors let you know. Try asking about it, my sister in law had them just break her water and she started going into labor on her own. Never had to get pitocin but she did get the epidural.

question: So this my 2nd baby with 1st I went into labor at 37 weeks everything went great. I had him natural, no meds. Well I'm 39 weeks today and have been contracting, but no dilation. The doctor have Schedule An induction for 9-9-15 and I am terrified. I heard it hurt very bad. if I start with meds its no longer a natural  birth. Ugh. How can I make this baby come on his own? I've tried sex, walking, pineapples, the doctor even tried to break my membranes. I really don't want to be  induced!!!!!
title: SCARED
